Job description

Welcoming a GUN CA to join the award winning team! Newly created role with an established builder entrenched in the commercial market.

About The Builder

Join Victoria’s most awarded Pool Builder who is 50 years young! Be part of a supportive team who operate like a larger corporate but feel like a family business, it’s the best of both worlds. Hit the ground running and show off your expertise with a full order book of luxury bespoke Residential and Commercial projects to sink your teeth into.

You can stay close to home and avoid the daily CBD commute with the office based in the South Eastern suburbs, right next door to the Peninsula. Enjoy a family (and sport) friendly work week from 8am- 4pm Monday- Friday- unheard of in Construction!

THE ROLE ITSELF

As an experienced Contract Administrator you will be managing the administrative and financial aspect of projects while working closely with the Preliminary team.

Duties include;
  • Preparing contract scope, request for tender documentation, proposals, permits and plans
  • Awarding and letting of contracts, negotiation & procurement
  • Measuring project performance milestones to help ensure DIFOT
  • Providing analysis and advice on current and future contracts
  • Compliance with company standards, procedures and industry legislation
  • Monitoring EOT's, RFI's, variations, progress claims etc with architects, clients and consultants


All About You
  • Tertiary qualifications within Building/Construction advantageous
  • 2 years’ experience as a CA preferably on commercial projects
  • Ability and desire to build strong working relationships
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and time management
  • Strong written and verbal communication


Culture And Benefits

Team members enjoy a flexible but stable working environment within an award-winning business. Personal development is encouraged, and my client constantly looks at ways to recognise the efforts of their talented team.

Work/life balance is a priority with a standard work week Monday-Friday 8am- 4pm. Healthy salary package in line with your experience level.

Call Carlie Bradley on 0405 370 548 for a confidential discussion about how this could be the right move for you or alternatively Apply Now.

Please note this role has been retained with NatRec ANZ and all inquiries will be managed by NatRec ANZ. My client will not accept unsolicited resumes.

Technical Analyst, System Solutions Unit

Company Name Department of Health & Human Services, Victoria Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 5 days ago Number of views 6 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Job Description

The Department of Health and Human Services develops and delivers policies, programs and services that support and enhance the wellbeing of all Victorians. Our services are in line with the government's vision for making Victoria a stronger, more caring and innovative state. Our vision is to achieve the best health, wellbeing and safety of all Victorians so that they can live a life they value. We are building an inclusive workplace that embraces diversity of backgrounds and differences to realise the potential of our employees for innovation and delivering services aimed at enhancing the lives of vulnerable Victorians. The department is committed to the safety of its clients. The department takes a zero tolerance approach to abuse, including child abuse and abuse of people with disability. Departmental employees are required to comply with all legal requirements including the Child Safe Standards to keep children safe from harm and abuse. All jobs can be worked flexibly and we encourage job applications from Aboriginal people, people with disabilities, LGBTI and people from culturally diverse backgrounds. If you want a career within a department striving to make Victoria the best place to be and helping shape communities we all want to be part of, then we encourage you to apply. If you are an Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander applicant, or if you have a disability, and require advice and support with the recruitment process, contact our Diversity Unit on DiversityInclusion@dhhs.vic.gov.au. The department has a zero tolerance towards violence within the workplace and recognises the rights of all staff to be free from violence and gender-related discrimination. We are proudly working with White Ribbon to create a safer workplace.

Number of vacancies available: x 3 vacancies, Fixed Term - Full Time (until 30/06/2019)

Office Location(s): 80 Collins St, Melbourne Vic 3000

Position Summary

The Department of Health and Human Services are embarking on a Department-wide initiation to deploy Office 365 to all users. The project is aligned to the Workplace Modernisation Strategy and will enable a flexible working environment, and modern tools for collaboration.

Reporting to Support Manager, Productivity Centre; you have general Office 365 technical knowledge to resolve both functional and technical problems, incident management; providing effective information and technology services; and support general customer/user queries and issues.

Are You?
  • A person who provides exemplary customer service?
  • Prior experiences supporting Office 365 and/or within a Support environment?
  • Keen for a challenge and willing to contribute to make the Productivity Centre a great team?
  • A flexible and adaptable team player who has worked within complex projects?


How To Apply

Applicants are encouraged to apply online, submitting a cover letter and a current resume.

Please Note

For this role, you are not required to address each of the key selection criteria in a separate written document. Applicants are strongly encouraged to review our Careers Page .This page provides information on the department's recruitment and safety screening processes.

Click 'Apply Now' below to submit your interest in this role.

For further information please visit the Department of Health and Human Services website: https://www.dhhs.vic.gov.au/

Applicants must be an Australian Citizen, Permanent Resident or hold a valid work permit or visa. Work eligibility will be checked as part of the recruitment process.

Warehouse / Picker Packer

Company Name Perspective Recruitment Company Location Derrimut, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 3 views

Job description

About The Client

Paying above the industry standard, our client invests in first-class equipment and distribution centres. Providing flexible shift options, excellent team culture and fabulous staff retention, working in this quick thinking, fast paced warehouse environment where there's a great sense of camaraderie, and a team working towards the same goal.

The Role

The positions involve using an electronic voice-picking system to pick and pack grocery products up to 16kg in weight, in a fast-paced and repetitive environment.

You will be provided with comprehensive training and support, job stability and tailored to be a valued member of the team.
Daily duties include despatch and staging orders, breakdown of inwards foods, voice picking, tugger operating and pallet wrapping.

If you value team culture, have good reading and numerical skills and take immense pride in your work, then this is an opportunity you should not miss. Primary duties can include selecting products accurately, safely and efficiently to deliver to the retail stores around the North-West regions of Melbourne.

Initially employed on a casual basis, a monthly roster offering an average of 20 - 30hrs per week, working 4-5 days per week.
The view to permanent part time after several months, where you recieve a generous pay increase, development opportunities and job security.

Shifts Available

6am - 12-1pm (approx.)
8am - 2-3pm (approx.)
09:30am - 4pm (approx.)
5:30pm - 11:30pm (approx.)
(Please specify your preference on shift commencement time in resume or cover letter)

Required Skills & Attributes
  • Ideally have experience as a pick/packer or warehouse operator
  • Must be available 7 days a week for rostering purposes (D/S or A/S)
  • Flexible with finishing times to ensure order completion
  • Able to work in a fast-paced, deadline driven environment
  • Voice picking experience advantageous
  • Pallet stacking, wrapping and palletising would be viewed upon favourably
  • Must be able to work unsupervised and use initiative
  • High focus on quality, accuracy and productivity
  • Own license and reliable transport is preferred
  • Previous experience within temperature controlled warehouses are encouraged to apply
  • Demonstrated reliability, punctuality and commitment to work
In return for your dedication and hard work, you will be provided ongoing stable employment that leads to permanent employment.
Furthermore, you will join a first class warehouse, be part of an excellent work culture that rewards their staff with a pay rate well above industry standards.

Please include in your Resume or Cover Letter your preferred start time
Please note : Only successful candidates will be contacted

Front Office & Reservations Manager

Company Name The Lancemore Group Company Location Chirnside Park, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 10 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

We are on the hunt for an experienced and charismatic Front Office & Reservations Manager, to lead our guest focused team in a highly challenging and influential role!

Reporting to the General Manager, you will oversee the entire front office operation and work closely with all other departments to drive and deliver overall success of the hotel. With the hands-on leadership style, you will develop a high performing team committed to deliver the guest service excellence and will work closely with the General Manager to implement revenue and yield strategies to optimize revenues for rooms.

About The Role
  • Lead & support a service focused team, overseeing all aspects of the day to day operation, so it runs like clockwork.
  • Manage a 7-day operation over 24 hours, with varied rosters covering day/night/weekend shifts including public holidays.
  • Establish specific and measurable goals covering all aspects of the Front Office operation, devise and implemented action plans for their achievement.
  • In liaison with the General Manager, analyse/forecast demand and establish and implement effective selling and rate strategies and optimal market mix, including group, transient, wholesale revenues.
  • Analyse, manage and respond to guest feedback/complaints, guest satisfaction and employee satisfaction information; and give a positive commitment to continuous improvement of product and performance in line with Standards.
  • Responsibility for effective recruitment, training and development, performance evaluation and optimisation of productivity through efficient work practices, operating procedures and staff rostering.
  • Maximise rooms revenues to achieve budgeted and forecasted targets by effective rate management, understanding performance drivers.
  • Ensuring all rates for property are visible, audited and current
  • Maintain open and positive communication with peers, superiors, and subordinates at all times.
  • Daily/weekly/monthly reporting.

About You
  • 2 Years’ plus experience in a similar role within 4.5* Hotel Environment
  • Hands on leadership style that inspire and support the team, particularly during those 'mad rush' moments
  • Team player, great personality and a passion for delivering the best service possible
  • Ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced environment, by taking initiative, prioritising and working collaboratively
  • An understanding of hotel reservation processes and, revenue management principles and their applications
  • Previous experience with OPERA PMS, SiteMinder and Channel Manage is highly desired
  • Get a kick out of hitting revenue targets and firing up your team to stay alert to selling opportunities
  • Proactive and positive mindset with a 'can do' attitude and attention to detail.
  • Ability to work a flexible 7-day roster; including weekends and public holidays.
  • First Aid and Responsible Service of Alcohol Certification
  • High level of computer literacy, specifically around Microsoft Excel

About Us

The Lancemore Group is a leading Australian boutique lifestyle brand and pioneer in boutique hotels and residential conference facilities. Currently we have six iconic hotels - Mansion Hotel & Spa at Werribee Park, Alamanda Palm Cove, Larmont Sydney, Lindenderry at Red Hill, Lancemore Hill at Macedon Ranges and Lindenwarrah at Milawa.
  • Our hotels offer boutique accommodation, conferences & meetings, weddings & events, wellness spas, critically acclaimed restaurants and an award winning wines.
  • We are rapidly expanding across Australia and are unique in being a family owned company that combines the head of a large operation with the heart of a family company.
  • You will be joining a high performing workplace that believes in developing new talent and empowering people to drive their own results

If you are a passionate, performance driven individual seeking to develop your hotel management career within a established boutique hotel brand, then apply now!

Associate Nurse Unit Manager - Cardiac/cardiothoracic Stepdown

Company Name Healthe Care Australia Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 1 view

Be an early applicant

Job description

Associate Nurse Unit Manager - Cardiac/cardiothoracic Stepdown

Are you seeking an opportunity to join a new, high caliber team in the development of new unit?

Attractive remuneration package

Major private hospital group

Integral leadership role in the commissioning of a new cardiac/ cardiothoracic stepdown ward and team..

About The Valley Private Hospital

We are an acute medical and surgical hospital with 226 beds, conveniently located in the south-eastern suburbs of Melbourne easily accessible via the Monash Freeway and East Link.

Our Services Include

24-hour Emergency Department

10 bed Intensive Care Unit

17 bed Coronary Care Unit

9 Operating Theatres including a Hybrid Theatre, Cardiac Catheter Laboratory and Endoscopy Suite

Day Procedure Unit

Short Stay Unit

Medical & Surgical Wards

Consulting Suites (on-site and off-site)

Diagnostic Imaging (including EOS)

Pathology

Radiation Oncology (operated by ICON)

As part of the continual growth and redevelopment of Burnett ward, we are looking for an experienced Registered Nurse to join our growing team. Burnett Ward is undergoing change, transitioning into a 29 bed cardiac/cardiothoracic unit, with ICU and CCU stepdown beds. It will include the ability to have telemetry capacity. The role of the Associate Nurse Unit Manager (ANUM), incorporates assisting with the management and administration of the unit in conjunction with the facilitation of best practice nursing standards and care.

Reporting to the Nurse Unit Manager of Burnett, the successful applicant will act as both a leader and a clinical resource in this acute setting, while directly contributing to the development and implementation of policies and procedures appropriate to the unit and the hospital. Change management and the building of new teams will be an integral component of this role. This is an exciting time of growth and change for The Valley Private and we are seeking exceptional nurses to join our progressive team.

The success profile and key accountabilities of this position include:

Supporting the Nurse Unit Manager in providing strong, effective leadership, and change management strategies within the Burnett ward

Ensure the professional development and support of the staff

Delivery of safe, effective, direct and indirect, patient centered care throughout the continuum of care from point of admission to discharge.

Facilitation of the Australian Clinical Health Standards, providing exceptional care to our patients to ensure positive patient experience.

Development of strong collaborative relationships with our Visiting Medical Officers.

Requiring an understanding of financial acumen, ensuring bed utilisation, efficient labour management and supply management

Enhancement of relationships with other departments within the hospital

Sound judgement and decision making in consultation with key stakeholders to ensure that service delivery of the unit is in line with the hospital strategic plan.

Essential Criteria

Bachelor degree in nursing

Postgraduate qualification in critical or cardiac care highly desirable, but not essential.

Previous management experience within an acute hospital environment

Flexibility to work a 7 day rotating roster – including night duty

Strong customer service

Self-motivated and proven ability to work as part of a collaborative team

Applications Close Monday 10th September, 2018

Applications including cover letter, curriculum vitae and two professional referees
